verb.description: Cut the hair off one's face with a razor.
examples: he washed, shaved, and had breakfast

verb.description: Cut (a thin slice or slices) from the surface of something.
examples: scrape a large sharp knife across the surface, shaving off rolls of very fine chocolate

verb.description: Pass or send something close to (something else), missing it narrowly.
examples: Scott shaved the post in the 29th minute

noun.description: An act of shaving hair from the face or a part of the body.

origin: Old English sc(e)afan scrape away the surface of (something) by paring, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch schaven and German schaben.
